attributes.action: stop a second referendum and a peoples vote on brexit
attributes.additional_details: Parliament asked the people in a referendum to vote on leaving the EU in a democratic vote the majority voted to leave, the government has continually said in parliament that the referendum would be honoured, In parliament a vote was held and parliament voted to trigger article 50 meaning the UK would leave the EU on march the 29th 2019. There should be no going back on a democratic vote we there for ask that democracy is honoured and a second referendum or peoples vote should not go ahead.
attributes.background: In 2016 the people voted in a referendum to leave the EU by a majority, Democracy must be seen to be done we the people ask that  our vote be honoured by parliament and that a second referendum and peoples vote be rejected because the first has not been honoured yet by mp's
